item.title: Cross-queue Healthcare Data Security Management Platform Demo
Secure and Trusted Authentication Models under Edge Computing and Block Multi-Chaining
item.description:
This paper focuses on edge security. Based on ECDSA, edge computing is introduced in master-slave chain scenarios to achieve secure and trusted authentication, giving the cross-domain access model and authentication process.

**Congratulations!!! **
Until November 2023, our paper was selected as CNKI’s highly downloaded paper

item.title: National Natural Geoscience Project
item.description: During his master’s degree, as a technical backbone, he led four master’s students to participate in the application of this national nature project, and after this project was successfully declared, he participated in the project as the first student and completed an invention patent.

item.title: National Key Research and Development Programme
item.description: During his PhD, as a technical backbone, he led one doctoral student, six master’s students and five undergraduates to successfully complete the project advancement of the National Key Research and Development Programme ‘Research on Cross-queue Data Security Sharing Mechanism and Trusted Analysis Technology’.

item.title: A lightweight blockchain-based access control scheme for integrated edge computing in the internet of things
Urban Land Surface Temperature Monitoring and Surface Thermal Runoff Pollution Evaluation Using UAV Thermal Remote Sensing Technology
‘Access control model for Internet of Things (IoT) based on blockchain and edge computing’
item.description:
This paper is about Internet of Things (IoT) security. An attempt is made to implement Access control based on Blockchain in Cloud-Edge-End architecture and a SC-ABAC model and a simple prototype is given.SC-ABAC is a Smart Contract for Attribute Based Access control with improved POW consensus algorithm in the prototype.

**Congratulations!!! **
Until November 2023, our paper was selected as a Highly Cited and Highly Downloaded paper in CKI!

item.title: Top-level Project in Yunnan Province
item.description: During his master’s degree, as a technical backbone, he led four master’s students to participate in the writing of this provincial special application, and after the successful declaration of this project, he participated in the project as the first student and published CNKI highly cited and highly downloadable papers one.

item.title: School Science and Innovation Project
item.description: As a project leader during his master’s degree, he led five master’s students to complete this university-level science and innovation project.

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic

Academic | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One **Two** Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation
